q: What is the default Storage Engine in modern MySQL (5.5+)?

o: ACID compliant transactions, Row-level locking, Foreign Key support, Crash recovery
Table-level locking, No Transactions, Fast reads (historically), Full Text Search (historically)
String object with value chosen from a list of permitted values (stored as integer index)
String object that can have zero or more values chose from a list (Bitmask storage)
ENUM = One value from list. SET = Multiple values from list.

q: MySQL command to show detailed table structure (DDL)?

o: Attribute for integer column to generate unique identity values automatically

q: How to get last inserted ID in MySQL?

o: LIMIT 10, 5 means 'Skip 10, Take 5' (Alternative to LIMIT 5 OFFSET 10)
CONCAT(a, b) function. || is Logical OR (by default in non-ANSI mode).
System variable controlling syntax strictness (e.g. STRICT_TRANS_TABLES, ANSI)
Command line utility to perform logical backups (produces SQL script)
No. Must emulate with LEFT JOIN UNION RIGHT JOIN.
Non-standard SQL. Inserts, or if Key conflict detected, Deletes old row and Inserts new one.
It performs DELETE + INSERT. Triggers ON DELETE fire. New ID generated if auto_increment.

q: What is 'INSERT ... ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE'?
o: MySQL Upsert syntax. Updates row if PK/Unique conflict exists, otherwise Inserts.
Function returning current date and time (Statement start time)
SYSDATE() returns time of execution (can change within query loop). NOW() is constant per query.
Quote identifier (Table/Column names) to handle spaces or reserved words. `select`.
Virtual database containing metadata (tables, columns, privileges)
Contains info about tables (Rows, Data_length, Engine)
System database containing user accounts (user table), privileges, timezones
Database for monitoring server execution at low level (events, waits, locks)
Aggregates values into a string list. GROUP_CONCAT(col SEPARATOR ', ')
IFNULL(expr1, expr2). Returns expr1 if not NULL, else expr2. (Known as COALESCE in std SQL)
NULLIF(e1, e2). Returns NULL if e1 = e2, else e1.
Comparisons are case-sensitive (byte by byte). WHERE col = BINARY 'Value'.
Generally Case-Insensitive (latin1_swedish_ci or utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci) for strings
Set of rules for comparing characters in a character set
Default mode. Searches for words. Ignores stop words.
Allows only non-negative values, effectively doubling the positive range
Pads the displayed value with zeros to the display width. Implies UNSIGNED.
Fixed-point number. M = total digits, D = decimal places. Exact precision.
FLOAT = 4 bytes (approximate). DOUBLE = 8 bytes (approximate, more precision).
Fixed-length string (N chars). Padded with spaces. Max 255.
Variable-length string (up to N chars). Max 65,535 bytes.
Variable-length text. TINYTEXT, TEXT, MEDIUMTEXT, LONGTEXT (different max sizes).
Binary Large Object. TINYBLOB, BLOB, MEDIUMBLOB, LONGBLOB.
TEXT has character set/collation. BLOB is binary (no charset).
Date and time (1000-01-01 to 9999-12-31). No timezone. 8 bytes.
Unix timestamp (1970-2038 range historically, extended in newer versions). Timezone aware. 4 bytes.
DATETIME = No timezone, wider range. TIMESTAMP = Timezone aware, auto-updates.
Time only (HH:MM:SS). Can represent duration (negative, > 24 hours).
Native JSON data type. Validated and stored in binary format. Supports indexing.
GEOMETRY, POINT, LINESTRING, POLYGON for geographic data
Shows execution plan for a query
Returns execution plan in JSON format (more details)
Updates table statistics for query optimizer
Reclaims unused space and defragments data (rebuilds table for InnoDB)
Repairs corrupted table (MyISAM mainly, limited InnoDB support)
Closes all open tables and flushes query cache
Reloads grant tables from mysql database (after manual privilege changes)
SHOW GRANTS FOR 'user'@'host'; Shows privileges for a user
SET GLOBAL var = value; Changes global variable (requires privilege)
SET SESSION var = value; Changes variable for current session only
Size of InnoDB buffer pool (cache for data/indexes). Most important tuning parameter.
Maximum number of simultaneous client connections
Size of query cache (removed in MySQL 8.0)
Threshold in seconds for slow query logging (default 10)
Logs all client connections and SQL statements (High overhead, debug only)
Records all changes to data (for replication and point-in-time recovery)
Logs SQL statements. Compact but may be non-deterministic.
Logs actual row changes. Deterministic but larger size.
Uses STATEMENT by default, switches to ROW when needed (Best of both)
PURGE BINARY LOGS TO 'log_name'; Deletes old binary logs
Auto-purge binary logs older than N days (Deprecated, use binlog_expire_logs_seconds)
File(s) containing InnoDB tables and indexes
System tablespace (contains data dictionary, undo logs, change buffer)
Each InnoDB table has its own .ibd file (innodb_file_per_table=ON, default)
Easier to reclaim space (DROP TABLE), better manageability, can move tables
Transaction log for crash recovery (ib_logfile0, ib_logfile1)
Stores old versions of rows for MVCC and rollback
Allows readers and writers to not block each other using row versioning
Controls durability. 1=Full ACID (flush on commit), 2=Flush every second, 0=No flush
1 (Safest, flushes to disk on every commit)
Size of each redo log file. Larger = better performance but slower recovery.
Master writes to binlog, Slave reads and applies changes (Asynchronous)
Configures slave to replicate from master (host, user, password, log position)
Starts replication threads (IO and SQL threads)
Replication lag in seconds (from SHOW SLAVE STATUS)
Unique identifier for each transaction (simplifies replication management)
Automatic failover, easier to promote slave, no need to track log positions
Master waits for at least one slave to acknowledge before committing (Hybrid)
Multi-master replication with automatic conflict detection and resolution
High availability solution using Group Replication + MySQL Router + MySQL Shell
Lightweight middleware for routing connections to available MySQL servers
Splitting a table into smaller physical pieces (RANGE, LIST, HASH, KEY)
Partitions based on column value ranges (e.g. by year)
Distributes rows evenly using hash function
Partitions based on discrete values (e.g. by region)
Suggests optimal data types for columns (Deprecated)
Default index type for InnoDB and MyISAM (Balanced tree)
Only for MEMORY engine. Fast equality lookups, no range queries.
Index for full-text search (InnoDB and MyISAM)
Index for geometric data types (GEOMETRY, POINT, etc)
Index containing all columns needed by query (avoids table access)
Index on multiple columns (Order matters: leftmost prefix rule)
Index (a,b,c) can be used for (a), (a,b), (a,b,c) but not (b) or (c) alone
Estimate of unique values in index (Higher = more selective = better)
SELECT * FROM t USE INDEX (idx_name) WHERE ...; Suggests index to optimizer
Forces optimizer to use specified index (stronger than USE INDEX)
Tells optimizer to ignore specified index
Forces join order as written in query
Prevents result from being cached in query cache (Deprecated with query cache)
SELECT ... LOCK IN SHARE MODE; Acquires shared lock (allows other reads, blocks writes)
SELECT ... FOR UPDATE; Acquires exclusive lock (blocks reads with LOCK IN SHARE MODE and writes)
Two or more transactions waiting for each other to release locks (Circular dependency)
Automatically detects and rolls back one transaction (victim)
Seconds to wait for lock before timing out (Default 50)
Shows detailed InnoDB internals (locks, transactions, buffer pool, etc)
Shows locks held and requested (Deprecated, use performance_schema)
Precompiled SQL code stored in database (CREATE PROCEDURE)
Returns a single value (CREATE FUNCTION ... RETURNS type)
Procedure: No return value, can have OUT params. Function: Returns value, used in expressions.
Changes statement delimiter (needed for procedures/functions with multiple statements)
Automatically executed code on INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE events
BEFORE: Can modify NEW values. AFTER: Cannot modify, sees final state.
NEW = new row values. OLD = old row values. (INSERT has NEW, DELETE has OLD, UPDATE has both)
Virtual table based on SELECT query (CREATE VIEW)

Must be ON to run scheduled events
Pointer to result set allowing row-by-row processing
Prepares SQL statement for execution (PREPARE stmt FROM 'SELECT ...')
Character set = symbols and encodings. Collation = comparison rules.
Full UTF-8 encoding (4 bytes, supports emojis). Recommended over utf8 (3 bytes max).

Returns first non-NULL value from list

REPLACE(str, from_str, to_str) - Replaces all occurrences
LENGTH = bytes. CHAR_LENGTH = characters (different for multi-byte charsets).
MOD(n, m) or n % m - Modulo (remainder)
POW(x, y) - x raised to power y

DATE_FORMAT(date, format) - Formats date as string
STR_TO_DATE(str, format) - Parses string to date

Returns name of day (Monday, Tuesday, etc)
Returns name of month (January, February, etc)
Converts date to Unix timestamp (seconds since 1970-01-01)
TIMESTAMPDIFF(unit, datetime1, datetime2) - Difference in specified unit
TIMESTAMPADD(unit, interval, datetime) - Adds interval to datetime
Function that performs calculation across set of rows related to current row
Assigns sequential number to each row within partition
Assigns rank with gaps for ties (1, 2, 2, 4)
Assigns rank without gaps for ties (1, 2, 2, 3)
NTILE(n) - Divides rows into n buckets
LAG(col, offset) - Accesses previous row value
LEAD(col, offset) - Accesses next row value
Returns first value in window frame
Returns last value in window frame
Defines window for window function (PARTITION BY, ORDER BY)

q: What is 'PARTITION BY' in window function?
o: Divides result set into partitions (like GROUP BY but doesn't collapse rows)
WITH clause defining temporary named result set (MySQL 8.0+)
CTE that references itself (for hierarchical/tree data)
WITH cte_name AS (SELECT ...) SELECT ... FROM cte_name

JSON_SET(json_doc, path, val) - Sets value in JSON (creates if not exists)

Replaces value only if path exists

Returns path to value in JSON document
Returns keys from JSON object as JSON array
Returns length of JSON document (number of elements)
Converts JSON data to relational table
Column not shown in SELECT * (must be explicitly named)
Column value computed from expression (VIRTUAL or STORED)

How far down LRU list page cleaner scans for dirty pages

Before downgrade or major version change (full purge and merge)

Exports query results to file on server

Enables LOAD DATA LOCAL INFILE (disabled by default for security)
Accesses tables on remote MySQL server (like foreign data wrapper)
Accepts data but doesn't store it (for replication filtering/testing)

Collection of identical MyISAM tables treated as one

o: Managed MySQL service on Google Cloud Platform

q: What happens if table has no PRIMARY KEY?
o: InnoDB uses first UNIQUE NOT NULL index, or creates hidden 6-byte ROW_ID

q: Why avoid UUID as PRIMARY KEY?
o: Random order causes page splits, fragmentation, larger secondary indexes
When page is full, half the records move to new page (fragmentation)
When adjacent pages are underfull, they merge (defragmentation)
Percentage of page filled (lower = more free space for updates)
Dynamically adjusts dirty page flushing rate based on workload
Checkpoint that doesn't flush all dirty pages (continuous process)
LSN up to which all dirty pages have been flushed
Replays redo log from checkpoint LSN to restore consistency after crash
Automatic recovery on startup after unclean shutdown
Removes old undo log records no longer needed for MVCC
Number of undo log pages waiting to be purged (high = problem)
